Subject: Re: APP vs. Atom (was: A REST replacement for SOAP.....Atom?)

Mike asks:

> Does anyone else find the use of the acronym "APP" confusing as opposed to
> just "Atom?"  Is there a reason they are different?

Though I'm not too partial to the APP acronym, given how oftern the term 
"app" is uses in the IT field, there does need to be a distinction between 
the Atom XML format (what feeds and entries look like) and the Atom 
Publishing Protocol (how to use HTTP/REST to access/manipulate 
feeds/entries), since they are different things altogether.




Andrzej Jan Taramina
